trans-unit.source: Describes the page size for paper or other media.

For a class that includes the same information about the media size as <xref:System.Printing.PageMediaSize> and also includes information about the imageable area of the page, see <xref:System.Printing.PrintDocumentImageableArea>.
Classes within the <xref:System.Printing> namespace are not supported for use within a Windows service or ASP.NET application or service.
Attempting to use these classes from within one of these application types may produce unexpected problems, such as diminished service performance and run-time exceptions.
If you want to print from a Windows Forms application, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PageMediaSize"></xref> class by using the specified <xref href="System.Printing.PageMediaSizeName"></xref>.

The name of the page size for paper (or other media), for example, <xref href="System.Printing.PageMediaSizeName.NorthAmericaLetter"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PageMediaSizeName.ISOA4"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PageMediaSize"></xref> class by using the width and height.
The width, in pixels, which are 1/96 inch units.
The height, in pixels, which are 1/96 inch units.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PageMediaSize"></xref> class by using the specified <xref href="System.Printing.PageMediaSizeName"></xref> and the width and height.

The name of the page size for paper (or other media), for example, <xref href="System.Printing.PageMediaSizeName.NorthAmericaLetter"></xref> or <xref href="System.Printing.PageMediaSizeName.ISOA4"></xref>.
The width, in pixels, which are 1/96 inch units.
The height, in pixels, which are 1/96 inch units.
Gets the page height.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the page height, in pixels, which are 1/96 inch units.
Gets the name of the page size for paper or other media.
A <xref href="System.Printing.PageMediaSizeName"></xref> value that names the page size.
Displays the page size for paper or other media.
The format of the returned string is as follows:
<xref:System.Printing.PageMediaSizeName> (<xref:System.Printing.PageMediaSize.Width%2A> x <xref:System.Printing.PageMediaSize.Height%2A>)
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that represents the page size for paper or other media.
Gets the page width.
A <xref href="System.Double"></xref> that represents the page width, in pixels, which are 1/96 inch units.
